text: Fabio Baldato (born 13 June 1968) is an Italian former racing cyclist. In 2008, he was the oldest rider in a ProTour team. His cycling career ended when he crashed heavily in the Eneco Tour.http://www.telegraaf.nl/telesport/wielersport/1793557/__Wielercarrire_Baldato_voorbij__.html He also competed at the 1988 Summer Olympics and the 1996 Summer Olympics. ==Major results== * Tour of Austria ** 2 stages (1994) ** 1 stage (2006–2007) * Tour of Poland ** 2 stages (2004) ** 1 stage (2003) * Giro d'Italia ** 3 stages (1993) ** 1 stage (2003) * Driedaagse van de Panne ** 1 stage & Points Classification (2003) ** 1 stage (1995–2002) * Étoile de Bessèges – 1 stage & GC (2003) * Trofeo dell'Etna (2002) * Giro della Provincia di Siracusa (2002) * Trofeo Pantalica (2002) * Giro della Liguria – 1 stage (2002) * Tour de Luxembourg – 1 stage (1996–2001) * Paris–Nice ** 2 stages (1994) ** 1 stage (1995–2000) * Milan–San Remo – 2nd (2000) * HEW Cyclassic Hamburg – 3rd (2000) * Tour Méditerranéen – 1 stage (1995–1999) * Tour of Denmark – 1 stage (1999) * Rund um den Henninger Turm (1998) * Tour de Romandie – 1 stage (1998) * Coppa Bernocchi (1996) * Tour de France – 1 stage (1995–1996) * Vuelta a España – 2 stages (1996) * Tour of Flanders – 2nd (1995–1996) * Gent–Wevelgem – 3rd (1996) * Rund um die Nürnberger Altstadt (1995) * Hofbrau Cup – 1 stage (1995) * Volta a la Comunitat Valenciana – 1 stage (1995) * Paris–Roubaix – 2nd (1994) * Setmana Catalana de Ciclisme – 1 stage (1993) * Ronde van Nederland – 1 stage (1993) * Criterium d'Abruzzo (1991) * World U23 Track Championships, Points Race – 2nd (1989) * National U19 Road Championship (1986) * World U19 Track Championships, Team Pursuit title: Fabio Baldato
